entry.description: Corresponds to the _atom_site_adp_type term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: A standard code used to describe the type of atomic displacement parameters used for the site.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _atom_site_aniso_label term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Anisotropic atomic displacement parameters are usually looped in a separate list. If this is the case, this code must match the _atom_site_label of the associated atom in the atom coordinate list and conform with the same rules described in _atom_site_label.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _atom_site_aniso_ratio term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Ratio of the maximum to minimum principal axes of displacement (thermal) ellipsoids.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _atom_site_aniso_type_symbol term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: This _atom_type_symbol code links the anisotropic atom parameters to the atom-type data associated with this site and must match one of the _atom_type_symbol codes in this list.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _atom_site_attached_hydrogens term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The number of hydrogen atoms attached to the atom at this site excluding any hydrogen atoms for which coordinates (measured or calculated) are given.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _atom_site_B_equiv_geom_mean term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Equivalent isotropic atomic displacement parameter, B(equiv), in angstroms squared, calculated as the geometric mean of the anisotropic atomic displacement parameters. B(equiv) = (B~i~ B~j~ B~k~)^1/3^ B~n~ = the principal components of the orthogonalized B^ij^ The IUCr Commission on Nomenclature recommends against the use of B for reporting atomic displacement parameters. U, being directly proportional to B, is preferred.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _atom_site_B_iso_or_equiv term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Isotropic atomic displacement parameter, or equivalent isotropic atomic displacement parameter, B(equiv), in angstroms squared, calculated from anisotropic displacement components. B(equiv) = (1/3) sum~i~[sum~j~(B^ij^ a*~i~ a*~j~ a~i~ a~j~)] a = the real-space cell lengths a* = the reciprocal-space cell lengths B^ij^ = 8 pi^2^ U^ij^ Ref: Fischer, R. X. & Tillmanns, E. (1988). Acta Cryst. C44, 775-776. The IUCr Commission on Nomenclature recommends against the use of B for reporting atomic displacement parameters. U, being directly proportional to B, is preferred.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _atom_site_calc_attached_atom term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The _atom_site_label of the atom site to which the 'geometry- calculated' atom site is attached.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _atom_site_calc_flag term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: A standard code to signal whether the site coordinates have been determined from the intensities or calculated from the geometry of surrounding sites, or have been assigned dummy coordinates. The abbreviation 'c' may be used in place of 'calc'.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _atom_site_chemical_conn_number term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: This number links an atom site to the chemical connectivity list. It must match a number specified by _chemical_conn_atom_number.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _atom_site_constraints term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: A description of the constraints applied to parameters at this site during refinement. See also _atom_site_refinement_flags and _refine_ls_number_constraints.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _atom_site_description term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: A description of special aspects of this site. See also _atom_site_refinement_flags.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _atom_site_disorder_assembly term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: A code which identifies a cluster of atoms that show long-range positional disorder but are locally ordered. Within each such cluster of atoms, _atom_site_disorder_group is used to identify the sites that are simultaneously occupied. This field is only needed if there is more than one cluster of disordered atoms showing independent local order.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _atom_site_disorder_group term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: A code which identifies a group of positionally disordered atom sites that are locally simultaneously occupied. Atoms that are positionally disordered over two or more sites (e.g. the hydrogen atoms of a methyl group that exists in two orientations) can be assigned to two or more groups. Sites belonging to the same group are simultaneously occupied, but those belonging to different groups are not. A minus prefix (e.g. "-1") is used to indicate sites disordered about a special position.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _atom_site_label term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The _atom_site_label is a unique identifier for a particular site in the crystal. This code is made up of a sequence of up to seven components, _atom_site_label_component_0 to *_6, which may be specified as separate data items. Component 0 usually matches one of the specified _atom_type_symbol codes. This is not mandatory if an _atom_site_type_symbol item is included in the atom-site list. The _atom_site_type_symbol always takes precedence over an _atom_site_label in the identification of the atom type. The label components 1 to 6 are optional, and normally only components 0 and 1 are used. Note that components 0 and 1 are concatenated, while all other components, if specified, are separated by an underscore. Underscores are only used if higher-order components exist. If an intermediate component is not used, it may be omitted provided the underscore separators are inserted. For example, the label 'C233__ggg' is acceptable and represents the components C, 233, '' and ggg. Different labels may have a different number of components.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _atom_site_occupancy term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The fraction of the atom type present at this site. The sum of the occupancies of all the atom types at this site may not significantly exceed 1.0 unless it is a dummy site. The value must lie in the 99.97% Gaussian confidence interval -3u =< x =< 1 + 3u. The _enumeration_range of 0.0:1.0 is thus correctly interpreted as meaning (0.0 - 3u) =< x =< (1.0 + 3u).

entry.description: Corresponds to the _atom_site_refinement_flags term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: A concatenated series of single-letter codes which indicate the refinement restraints or constraints applied to this site. This item should not be used. It has been replaced by _atom_site_refinement_flags_posn, *_adp and *_occupancy. It is retained in this dictionary only to provide compatibility with legacy CIFs.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _atom_site_refinement_flags_adp term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: A code which indicates the refinement restraints or constraints applied to the atomic displacement parameters of this site.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _atom_site_refinement_flags_occupancy term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: A code which indicates that refinement restraints or constraints were applied to the occupancy of this site.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _atom_site_refinement_flags_posn term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: A code which indicates the refinement restraints or constraints applied to the positional coordinates of this site.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _atom_site_restraints term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: A description of restraints applied to specific parameters at this site during refinement. See also _atom_site_refinement_flags and _refine_ls_number_restraints.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _atom_site_symmetry_multiplicity term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The multiplicity of a site due to the space-group symmetry as given in International Tables for Crystallography Vol. A (2002).

entry.description: Corresponds to the _atom_site_thermal_displace_type term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: A standard code used to describe the type of atomic displacement parameters used for the site.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _atom_site_type_symbol term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: A code to identify the atom species (singular or plural) occupying this site. This code must match a corresponding _atom_type_symbol. The specification of this code is optional if component 0 of the _atom_site_label is used for this purpose. See _atom_type_symbol.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _atom_site_U_equiv_geom_mean term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Equivalent isotropic atomic displacement parameter, U(equiv), in angstroms squared, calculated as the geometric mean of the anisotropic atomic displacement parameters. U(equiv) = (U~i~ U~j~ U~k~)^1/3^ U~n~ = the principal components of the orthogonalized U^ij^

entry.description: Corresponds to the _atom_site_U_iso_or_equiv term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Isotropic atomic displacement parameter, or equivalent isotropic atomic displacement parameter, U(equiv), in angstroms squared, calculated from anisotropic atomic displacement parameters. U(equiv) = (1/3) sum~i~[sum~j~(U^ij^ a*~i~ a*~j~ a~i~ a~j~)] a = the real-space cell lengths a* = the reciprocal-space cell lengths Ref: Fischer, R. X. & Tillmanns, E. (1988). Acta Cryst. C44, 775-776.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _atom_site_Wyckoff_symbol term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The Wyckoff symbol (letter) as listed in the space-group tables of International Tables for Crystallography Vol. A (2002).

entry.description: Corresponds to the _atom_sites_Cartn_transform_axes term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: A description of the relative alignment of the crystal cell axes to the Cartesian orthogonal axes as applied in the transformation matrix _atom_sites_Cartn_tran_matrix_.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _atom_sites_special_details term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Additional information about the atomic coordinates not coded elsewhere in the CIF.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _atom_type_analytical_mass_% term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Mass percentage of this atom type derived from chemical analysis.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _atom_type_description term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: A description of the atom(s) designated by this atom type. In most cases, this will be the element name and oxidation state of a single atom species. For disordered or nonstoichiometric structures it will describe a combination of atom species.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _atom_type_number_in_cell term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Total number of atoms of this atom type in the unit cell.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _atom_type_oxidation_number term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Formal oxidation state of this atom type in the structure.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _atom_type_scat_dispersion_source term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Reference to source of real and imaginary dispersion corrections for scattering factors used for this atom type.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _atom_type_scat_length_neutron term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The bound coherent scattering length in femtometres for the atom type at the isotopic composition used for the diffraction experiment.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _atom_type_scat_source term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Reference to source of scattering factors or scattering lengths used for this atom type.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _atom_type_scat_versus_stol_list term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: A table of scattering factors as a function of sin theta over lambda. This table should be well commented to indicate the items present. Regularly formatted lists are strongly recommended.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _atom_type_symbol term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The code used to identify the atom species (singular or plural) representing this atom type. Normally this code is the element symbol. The code may be composed of any character except an underscore with the additional proviso that digits designate an oxidation state and must be followed by a + or - character.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _audit_block_code term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: A code intended to identify uniquely the current data block.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _audit_creation_date term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The date that the data block was created. The date format is yyyy-mm-dd.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _audit_creation_method term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: A description of how data were entered into the data block.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _audit_update_record term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: A record of any changes to the data block. The update format is a date (yyyy-mm-dd) followed by a description of the changes. The latest update entry is added to the bottom of this record.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _audit_author_address term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The address of an author of this data block. If there are multiple authors, _audit_author_address is looped with _audit_author_name.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _audit_author_name term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The name of an author of this data block. If there are multiple authors, _audit_author_name is looped with _audit_author_address. The family name(s), followed by a comma and including any dynastic components, precedes the first name(s) or initial(s).

entry.description: Corresponds to the _audit_conform_dict_location term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: A file name or uniform resource locator (URL) for the dictionary to which the current data block conforms.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _audit_conform_dict_name term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The string identifying the highest-level dictionary defining data names used in this file.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _audit_conform_dict_version term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The version number of the dictionary to which the current data block conforms.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _audit_contact_author_address term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The mailing address of the author of the data block to whom correspondence should be addressed.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _audit_contact_author_email term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The electronic mail address of the author of the data block to whom correspondence should be addressed, in a form recognizable to international networks. The format of e-mail addresses is given in Section 3.4, Address Specification, of Internet Message Format, RFC 2822, P. Resnick (Editor), Network Standards Group, April 2001.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _audit_contact_author_fax term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The facsimile telephone number of the author of the data block to whom correspondence should be addressed. The recommended style starts with the international dialing prefix, followed by the area code in parentheses, followed by the local number with no spaces.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _audit_contact_author_name term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The name of the author of the data block to whom correspondence should be addressed. The family name(s), followed by a comma and including any dynastic components, precedes the first name(s) or initial(s).

entry.description: Corresponds to the _audit_contact_author_phone term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The telephone number of the author of the data block to whom correspondence should be addressed. The recommended style starts with the international dialing prefix, followed by the area code in parentheses, followed by the local number and any extension number prefixed by 'x', with no spaces.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _audit_link_block_code term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The value of _audit_block_code associated with a data block in the current file related to the current data block. The special value '.' may be used to refer to the current data block for completeness.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _audit_link_block_description term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: A textual description of the relationship of the referenced data block to the current one.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _cell_formula_units_Z term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The number of the formula units in the unit cell as specified by _chemical_formula_structural, _chemical_formula_moiety or _chemical_formula_sum.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _cell_measurement_pressure term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The pressure in kilopascals at which the unit-cell parameters were measured (not the pressure at which the sample was synthesized).

entry.description: Corresponds to the _cell_measurement_radiation term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Description of the radiation used to measure the unit-cell data. See also _cell_measurement_wavelength.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _cell_measurement_reflns_used term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The total number of reflections used to determine the unit cell. These reflections may be specified as _cell_measurement_refln_ data items.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _cell_measurement_temperature term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The temperature in kelvins at which the unit-cell parameters were measured (not the temperature of synthesis).

entry.description: Corresponds to the _cell_measurement_wavelength term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The wavelength in angstroms of the radiation used to measure the unit cell. If this is not specified, the wavelength is assumed to be the same as that given in _diffrn_radiation_wavelength.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _cell_special_details term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: A description of special aspects of the cell choice, noting possible alternative settings.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _cell_volume term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Cell volume V in angstroms cubed. V = a b c [1 - cos^2^(alpha) - cos^2^(beta) - cos^2^(gamma) + 2 cos(alpha) cos(beta) cos(gamma) ] ^1/2^ a = _cell_length_a b = _cell_length_b c = _cell_length_c alpha = _cell_angle_alpha beta = _cell_angle_beta gamma = _cell_angle_gamma

entry.description: Corresponds to the _cell_measurement_refln_theta term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Theta angle in degrees for the reflection used for measurement of the unit cell with the indices _cell_measurement_refln_index_.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _chemical_absolute_configuration term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Necessary conditions for the assignment of _chemical_absolute_configuration are given by H. D. Flack and G. Bernardinelli (1999, 2000). Ref: Flack, H. D. & Bernardinelli, G. (1999). Acta Cryst. A55, 908-915. (http://www.iucr.org/paper?sh0129) Flack, H. D. & Bernardinelli, G. (2000). J. Appl. Cryst. 33, 1143-1148. (http://www.iucr.org/paper?ks0021)

entry.description: Corresponds to the _chemical_compound_source term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Description of the source of the compound under study, or of the parent molecule if a simple derivative is studied. This includes the place of discovery for minerals or the actual source of a natural product.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _chemical_enantioexcess_bulk term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The enantioexcess of the bulk material from which the crystals were grown. A value of 0.0 indicates the racemate. A value of 1.0 indicates that the compound is enantiomerically pure. Enantioexcess is defined in the IUPAC Recommendations (Moss et al., 1996). The composition of the crystal and bulk must be the same. Ref: Moss G. P. et al. (1996). Basic Terminology of Stereochemistry. Pure Appl. Chem., 68, 2193-2222. http://www.chem.qmul.ac.uk/iupac/stereo/index.html

entry.description: Corresponds to the _chemical_enantioexcess_bulk_technique term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The experimental technique used to determine the enantioexcess of the bulk compound.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _chemical_enantioexcess_crystal term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The enantioexcess of the crystal used for the diffraction study. A value of 0.0 indicates the racemate. A value of 1.0 indicates that the crystal is enantiomerically pure. Enantioexcess is defined in the IUPAC Recommendations (Moss et al., 1996). Ref: Moss G. P. et al. (1996). Basic Terminology of Stereochemistry. Pure Appl. Chem., 68, 2193-2222. http://www.chem.qmul.ac.uk/iupac/stereo/index.html

entry.description: Corresponds to the _chemical_enantioexcess_crystal_technique term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The experimental technique used to determine the enantioexcess of the crystal.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _chemical_melting_point term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The temperature in kelvins at which the crystalline solid changes to a liquid.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _chemical_name_common term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Trivial name by which the compound is commonly known.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _chemical_name_mineral term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Mineral name accepted by the International Mineralogical Association. Use only for natural minerals. See also _chemical_compound_source.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _chemical_name_structure_type term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Commonly used structure-type name. Usually only applied to minerals or inorganic compounds.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _chemical_name_systematic term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: IUPAC or Chemical Abstracts full name of the compound.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _chemical_optical_rotation term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The optical rotation in solution of the compound is specified in the following format: '[\a]^TEMP^~WAVE~ = SORT (c = CONC, SOLV)' where: TEMP is the temperature of the measurement in degrees Celsius, WAVE is an indication of the wavelength of the light used for the measurement, CONC is the concentration of the solution given as the mass of the substance in g per 100 ml of solution, SORT is the signed value (preceded by a + or a - sign) of 100.\a/(l.c), where \a is the signed optical rotation in degrees measured in a cell of length l in dm and c is the value of CONC as defined above, and SOLV is the chemical formula of the solvent.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _chemical_properties_biological term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: A free-text description of the biological properties of the material.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _chemical_properties_physical term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: A free-text description of the physical properties of the material.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _chemical_temperature_decomposition term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The temperature in kelvins at which the solid decomposes.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _chemical_temperature_sublimation term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The temperature in kelvins at which the solid sublimes.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _chemical_conn_atom_charge term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The net integer charge assigned to this atom. This is the formal charge assignment normally found in chemical diagrams.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _chemical_conn_atom_NCA term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The number of connected atoms excluding terminal hydrogen atoms.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _chemical_conn_atom_NH term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The total number of hydrogen atoms attached to this atom, regardless of whether they are included in the refinement or the _atom_site_ list. This number will be the same as _atom_site_attached_hydrogens only if none of the hydrogen atoms appear in the _atom_site_ list.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _chemical_conn_atom_number term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The chemical sequence number to be associated with this atom.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _chemical_conn_atom_type_symbol term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: A code identifying the atom type. This code must match an _atom_type_symbol code in the _atom_type_ list or be a recognizable element symbol.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _chemical_conn_bond_type term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The chemical bond type associated with the connection between the two sites _chemical_conn_bond_atom_1 and *_2.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _chemical_formula_analytical term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Formula determined by standard chemical analysis including trace elements. See the _chemical_formula_[] category description for rules for writing chemical formulae. Parentheses are used only for standard uncertainties (e.s.d.'s).

entry.description: Corresponds to the _chemical_formula_iupac term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Formula expressed in conformance with IUPAC rules for inorganic and metal-organic compounds where these conflict with the rules for any other _chemical_formula_ entries. Typically used for formatting a formula in accordance with journal rules. This should appear in the data block in addition to the most appropriate of the other _chemical_formula_ data names. Ref: IUPAC (1990). Nomenclature of Inorganic Chemistry. Oxford: Blackwell Scientific Publications.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _chemical_formula_moiety term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Formula with each discrete bonded residue or ion shown as a separate moiety. See the _chemical_formula_[] category description for rules for writing chemical formulae. In addition to the general formulae requirements, the following rules apply: (1) Moieties are separated by commas ','. (2) The order of elements within a moiety follows general rule (5) in the _chemical_formula_[] category description. (3) Parentheses are not used within moieties but may surround a moiety. Parentheses may not be nested. (4) Charges should be placed at the end of the moiety. The charge '+' or '-' may be preceded by a numerical multiplier and should be separated from the last (element symbol + count) by a space. Pre- or post-multipliers may be used for individual moieties.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _chemical_formula_structural term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: See the _chemical_formula_[] category description for the rules for writing chemical formulae for inorganics, organometallics, metal complexes etc., in which bonded groups are preserved as discrete entities within parentheses, with post-multipliers as required. The order of the elements should give as much information as possible about the chemical structure. Parentheses may be used and nested as required. This formula should correspond to the structure as actually reported, i.e. trace elements not included in atom-type and atom-site lists should not be included in this formula (see also _chemical_formula_analytical).

entry.description: Corresponds to the _chemical_formula_sum term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: See the _chemical_formula_[] category description for the rules for writing chemical formulae in which all discrete bonded residues and ions are summed over the constituent elements, following the ordering given in general rule (5) in the _chemical_formula_[] category description. Parentheses are not normally used.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _chemical_formula_weight term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Formula mass in daltons. This mass should correspond to the formulae given under _chemical_formula_structural, *_iupac, *_moiety or *_sum and, together with the Z value and cell parameters, should yield the density given as _exptl_crystal_density_diffrn.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _chemical_formula_weight_meas term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Formula mass in daltons measured by a non-diffraction experiment.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _citation_abstract term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Abstract for the citation. This is used most when the citation is extracted from a bibliographic database that contains full text or abstract information.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _citation_abstract_id_CAS term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The Chemical Abstracts Service (CAS) abstract identifier; relevant for journal articles.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _citation_book_id_ISBN term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The International Standard Book Number (ISBN) code assigned to the book cited; relevant for books or book chapters.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _citation_book_publisher term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The name of the publisher of the citation; relevant for books or book chapters.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _citation_book_publisher_city term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The location of the publisher of the citation; relevant for books or book chapters.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _citation_book_title term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The title of the book in which the citation appeared; relevant for books or book chapters.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _citation_coordinate_linkage term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: _citation_coordinate_linkage states whether or not this citation is concerned with precisely the set of coordinates given in the data block. If, for instance, the publication described the same structure, but the coordinates had undergone further refinement prior to creation of the data block, the value of this data item would be 'no'.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _citation_country term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The country of publication; relevant for books and book chapters.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _citation_database_id_CSD term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Identifier ('refcode') of the database record in the Cambridge Structural Database that contains details of the cited structure.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _citation_database_id_Medline term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Accession number used by Medline to categorize a specific bibliographic entry.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _citation_id term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The value of _citation_id must uniquely identify a record in the _citation_ list. The _citation_id 'primary' should be used to indicate the citation that the author(s) consider to be the most pertinent to the contents of the data block. Note that this item need not be a number; it can be any unique identifier.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _citation_journal_abbrev term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Abbreviated name of the journal cited as given in the Chemical Abstracts Service Source Index.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _citation_journal_full term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Full name of the journal cited; relevant for journal articles.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _citation_journal_id_ASTM term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The American Society for Testing and Materials (ASTM) code assigned to the journal cited (also referred to as the CODEN designator of the Chemical Abstracts Service); relevant for journal articles.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _citation_journal_id_CSD term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The Cambridge Structural Database (CSD) code assigned to the journal cited; relevant for journal articles. This is also the system used at the Protein Data Bank (PDB).

entry.description: Corresponds to the _citation_journal_id_ISSN term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The International Standard Serial Number (ISSN) code assigned to the journal cited; relevant for journal articles.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _citation_journal_issue term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Issue number of the journal cited; relevant for journal articles.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _citation_journal_volume term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Volume number of the journal cited; relevant for journal articles.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _citation_language term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Language in which the cited article is written.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _citation_special_details term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: A description of special aspects of the relationship of the contents of the data block to the literature item cited.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _citation_title term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The title of the citation; relevant for journal articles, books and book chapters.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _citation_year term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The year of the citation; relevant for journal articles, books and book chapters.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _citation_author_citation_id term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The value of _citation_author_citation_id must match an identifier specified by _citation_id in the _citation_ list.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _citation_author_name term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Name of an author of the citation; relevant for journal articles, books and book chapters. The family name(s), followed by a comma and including any dynastic components, precedes the first name(s) or initial(s).

entry.description: Corresponds to the _citation_author_ordinal term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: This data name defines the order of the author's name in the list of authors of a citation.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _citation_editor_citation_id term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The value of _citation_editor_citation_id must match an identifier specified by _citation_id in the _citation_ list.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _citation_editor_name term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Name of an editor of the citation; relevant for books and book chapters. The family name(s), followed by a comma and including any dynastic components, precedes the first name(s) or initial(s).

entry.description: Corresponds to the _citation_editor_ordinal term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: This data name defines the order of the editor's name in the list of editors of a citation.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _database_code_depnum_ccdc_archive term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Deposition numbers assigned by the Cambridge Crystallographic Data Centre (CCDC) to files containing structural information archived by the CCDC.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _database_code_depnum_ccdc_fiz term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Deposition numbers assigned by the Fachinformationszentrum Karlsruhe (FIZ) to files containing structural information archived by the Cambridge Crystallographic Data Centre (CCDC).

entry.description: Corresponds to the _database_code_depnum_ccdc_journal term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Deposition numbers assigned by various journals to files containing structural information archived by the Cambridge Crystallographic Data Centre (CCDC).

entry.description: Corresponds to the _database_CSD_history term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: A history of changes made by the Cambridge Crystallographic Data Centre and incorporated into the Cambridge Structural Database (CSD).

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_ambient_environment term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The gas or liquid surrounding the sample, if not air.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_ambient_pressure term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The mean hydrostatic pressure in kilopascals at which the intensities were measured.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_ambient_temperature term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The mean temperature in kelvins at which the intensities were measured.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_crystal_treatment term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Remarks about how the crystal was treated prior to the intensity measurements. Particularly relevant when intensities were measured at low temperature.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_measured_fraction_theta_full term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Fraction of unique (symmetry-independent) reflections measured out to _diffrn_reflns_theta_full.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_measured_fraction_theta_max term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Fraction of unique (symmetry-independent) reflections measured out to _diffrn_reflns_theta_max.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_special_details term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Special details of the intensity-measurement process. Should include information about source instability, crystal motion, degradation and so on.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_symmetry_description term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Observed diffraction point symmetry, systematic absences and possible space group(s) or superspace group(s) compatible with these.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_attenuator_code term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: A code associated with a particular attenuator setting. This code is referenced by the _diffrn_refln_attenuator_code which is stored with the intensities. See _diffrn_attenuator_scale.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_attenuator_material term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Material from which the attenuator is made.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_attenuator_scale term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The scale factor applied when an intensity measurement is reduced by an attenuator identified by _diffrn_attenuator_code. The measured intensity must be multiplied by this scale to convert it to the same scale as unattenuated intensities.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_detector term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The general class of the radiation detector.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_detector_area_resol_mean term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The resolution of an area detector, in pixels/mm.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_detector_details term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: A description of special aspects of the radiation detector.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_detector_dtime term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The deadtime in microseconds of the detector used to measure the diffraction intensities.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_detector_type term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The make, model or name of the detector device used.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_radiation_detector term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The detector used to measure the diffraction intensities.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_radiation_detector_dtime term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The deadtime in microseconds of the detector used to measure the diffraction intensities.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_measurement_details term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: A description of special aspects of the intensity measurement.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_measurement_device term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The general class of goniometer or device used to support and orient the specimen.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_measurement_device_details term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: A description of special aspects of the device used to measure the diffraction intensities.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_measurement_device_type term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The make, model or name of the measurement device (goniometer) used.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_measurement_method term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Method used to measure the intensities.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_measurement_specimen_support term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The physical device used to support the crystal during data collection.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_orient_matrix_type term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: A description of the orientation matrix type and how it should be applied to define the orientation of the crystal precisely with respect to the diffractometer axes.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_radiation_collimation term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The collimation or focusing applied to the radiation.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_radiation_filter_edge term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Absorption edge in angstroms of the radiation filter used.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_radiation_inhomogeneity term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Half-width in millimetres of the incident beam in the direction perpendicular to the diffraction plane.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_radiation_monochromator term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The method used to obtain monochromatic radiation. If a mono- chromator crystal is used, the material and the indices of the Bragg reflection are specified.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_radiation_polarisn_norm term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The angle in degrees, as viewed from the specimen, between the perpendicular component of the polarization and the diffraction plane. See _diffrn_radiation_polarisn_ratio.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_radiation_polarisn_ratio term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Polarization ratio of the diffraction beam incident on the crystal. It is the ratio of the perpendicularly polarized to the parallel polarized components of the radiation. The perpendicular component forms an angle of _diffrn_radiation_polarisn_norm to the normal to the diffraction plane of the sample (i.e. the plane containing the incident and reflected beams).

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_radiation_probe term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The nature of the radiation used (i.e. the name of the subatomic particle or the region of the electromagnetic spectrum). It is strongly recommended that this information be given, so that the probe radiation can be simply determined.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_radiation_type term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The type of the radiation. This is used to give a more detailed description than _diffrn_radiation_probe and is typically a description of the X-ray wavelength in Siegbahn notation.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_radiation_xray_symbol term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The IUPAC symbol for the X-ray wavelength for the probe radiation.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_radiation_wavelength term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The radiation wavelength in angstroms.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_radiation_wavelength_determination term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The method of determination of incident wavelength.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_radiation_wavelength_id term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: An arbitrary code identifying each value of _diffrn_radiation_wavelength. Items in the DIFFRN_RADIATION category are looped when multiple wavelengths are used. This code is used to link with the _diffrn_refln_ list. It must match with one of the _diffrn_refln_wavelength_id codes.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_radiation_wavelength_wt term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The relative weight of a wavelength identified by the code _diffrn_radiation_wavelength_id in the list of wavelengths.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_refln_attenuator_code term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The code identifying the attenuator setting for this reflection. This code must match one of the _diffrn_attenuator_code values.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_refln_class_code term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The code identifying the class to which this reflection has been assigned. This code must match a value of _diffrn_reflns_class_code. Reflections may be grouped into classes for a variety of purposes. For example, for modulated structures each reflection class may be defined by the number m=sum|m~i~|, where the m~i~ are the integer coefficients that, in addition to h,k,l, index the corresponding diffraction vector in the basis defined for the reciprocal lattice.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_refln_crystal_id term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Code identifying each crystal if multiple crystals are used. Is used to link with _exptl_crystal_id in the _exptl_crystal_ list.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_refln_elapsed_time term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Elapsed time in minutes from the start of the diffraction experiment to the measurement of this intensity.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_refln_intensity_net term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Net intensity calculated from the diffraction counts after the attenuator and standard scales have been applied.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_refln_intensity_sigma term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Standard uncertainty (e.s.d.) of the net intensity calculated from the diffraction counts after the attenuator and standard scales have been applied.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_refln_intensity_u term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Standard uncertainty of the net intensity calculated from the diffraction counts after the attenuator and standard scales have been applied.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_refln_scale_group_code term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The code identifying the scale applicable to this reflection. This code must match with a specified _diffrn_scale_group_code value.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_refln_scan_mode term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The code identifying the mode of scanning for measurements using a diffractometer. See _diffrn_refln_scan_width and _diffrn_refln_scan_mode_backgd.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_refln_scan_mode_backgd term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The code identifying the mode of scanning a reflection to measure the background intensity.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_refln_scan_rate term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The rate of scanning a reflection in degrees per minute to measure the intensity.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_refln_scan_time_backgd term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The time spent measuring each background in seconds.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_refln_scan_width term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The scan width in degrees of the scan mode defined by the code _diffrn_refln_scan_mode.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_refln_sint/lambda term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The (sin theta)/lambda value in reciprocal angstroms for this reflection.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_refln_standard_code term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: A code indicating that this reflection was measured as a standard reflection. The value must be '.' or match one of the _diffrn_standard_refln_code values.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_refln_wavelength term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The mean wavelength in angstroms of the radiation used to measure the intensity of this reflection. This is an important parameter for reflections measured using energy-dispersive detectors or the Laue method.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_refln_wavelength_id term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Code identifying the wavelength in the _diffrn_radiation_ list.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_reflns_av_R_equivalents term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The residual [sum av|del(I)| / sum |av(I)|] for symmetry-equivalent reflections used to calculate the average intensity av(I). The av|del(I)| term is the average absolute difference between av(I) and the individual symmetry-equivalent intensities.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_reflns_av_sigmaI/netI term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Measure [sum |u(net I)|/sum|net I|] for all measured reflections.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_reflns_av_unetI/netI term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Measure [sum |u(net I)|/sum|net I|] for all measured reflections.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_reflns_Laue_measured_fraction_full term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Fraction of Laue unique reflections (symmetry-independent in the Laue group) measured out to the resolution given in _diffrn_reflns_resolution_full or _diffrn_reflns_theta_full. The Laue group always contains a centre of symmetry so that the reflection h,k,l is always equivalent to the reflection -h,-k,-l even in space groups without a centre of symmetry. This number should not be less than 0.95, since it represents the fraction of reflections measured in the part of the diffraction pattern that is essentially complete.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_reflns_Laue_measured_fraction_max term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Fraction of Laue unique reflections (symmetry-independent in the Laue group) measured out to the resolution given in _diffrn_reflns_resolution_max or _diffrn_reflns_theta_max. The Laue group always contains a centre of symmetry so that the reflection h,k,l is always equivalent to the reflection -h,-k,-l even in space groups without a centre of symmetry.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_reflns_number term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The total number of measured intensities, excluding reflections that are classed as systematically absent arising from translational symmetry in the crystal unit cell.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_reflns_point_group_measured_fraction_full term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Fraction of crystal point-group unique reflections (i.e. symmetry-independent in the crystal point group) measured out to the resolution given in _diffrn_reflns_resolution_full or _diffrn_reflns_theta_full. For space groups that do not contain a centre of symmetry the reflections h,k,l and -h,-k,-l are independent. This number should not be less than 0.95, since it represents the fraction of reflections measured in the part of the diffraction pattern that is essentially complete.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_reflns_point_group_measured_fraction_max term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Fraction of crystal point-group unique reflections (i.e. symmetry-independent in the crystal point group) measured out to the resolution given in _diffrn_reflns_resolution_max or _diffrn_reflns_theta_max. For space groups that do not contain a centre of symmetry the reflections h,k,l and -h,-k,-l are independent.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_reflns_reduction_process term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: A description of the process used to reduce the intensities into structure-factor magnitudes.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_reflns_resolution_full term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The resolution in reciprocal angstroms at which the measured reflection count is close to complete. The fraction of unique reflections measured out to this angle is given by _diffrn_measured_fraction_theta_full.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_reflns_resolution_max term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Maximum resolution in reciprocal angstroms of the measured diffraction pattern. The fraction of unique reflections measured out to this angle is given by _diffrn_measured_fraction_theta_max

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_reflns_theta_full term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The theta angle (in degrees) at which the measured reflection count is close to complete. The fraction of unique reflections measured out to this angle is given by _diffrn_measured_fraction_theta_full.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_reflns_theta_max term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Maximum theta angle in degrees for the measured intensities. The fraction of unique reflections measured out to this angle is given by _diffrn_measured_fraction_theta_max

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_reflns_theta_min term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Minimum theta angle in degrees for the measured intensities.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_reflns_class_av_R_eq term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: For each reflection class, the residual [sum av|del(I)|/sum|av(I)|] for symmetry-equivalent reflections used to calculate the average intensity av(I). The av|del(I)| term is the average absolute difference between av(I) and the individual intensities.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_reflns_class_av_sgI/I term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Measure [sum|u(net I)|/sum|net I|] for all measured intensities in a reflection class.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_reflns_class_av_uI/I term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Measure [sum|u(net I)|/sum|net I|] for all measured intensities in a reflection class.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_reflns_class_code term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The code identifying a certain reflection class.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_reflns_class_d_res_high term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The smallest value in angstroms of the interplanar spacings of the reflections in each reflection class. This is called the highest resolution for this reflection class.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_reflns_class_d_res_low term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The highest value in angstroms of the interplanar spacings of the reflections in each reflection class. This is called the lowest resolution for this reflection class.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_reflns_class_description term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Description of each reflection class.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_reflns_class_number term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The total number of measured intensities for each reflection class, excluding the systematic absences arising from centring translations.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_scale_group_code term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The code identifying a specific measurement group (e.g. for multi-film or multi-crystal data). The code must match a _diffrn_refln_scale_group_code in the reflection list.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_scale_group_I_net term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The scale for a specific measurement group which is to be multiplied with the net intensity to place all intensities in the _diffrn_refln_ or _refln_ list on a common scale.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_radiation_source term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The source of radiation.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_source term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The general class of the source of radiation.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_source_current term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The current in milliamperes at which the radiation source was operated.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_source_details term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: A description of special aspects of the source.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_source_power term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The power in kilowatts at which the radiation source was operated.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_source_size term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The dimensions of the source as viewed from the sample.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_source_take-off_angle term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The complement of the angle in degrees between the normal to the surface of the X-ray tube target and the primary X-ray beam for beams generated by traditional X-ray tubes.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_source_target term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The chemical element symbol for the X-ray target (usually the anode) used to generate X-rays. This can also be used for spallation sources.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_source_type term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The make, model or name of the source of radiation.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_source_voltage term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The voltage in kilovolts at which the radiation source was operated.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_standard_refln_code term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The code identifying a reflection measured as a standard reflection with the indices _diffrn_standard_refln_index_. This is the same code as the _diffrn_refln_standard_code in the _diffrn_refln_ list.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_standards_decay_% term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The percentage decrease in the mean intensity of the set of standard reflections measured at the start of the measurement process and at the finish. This value usually affords a measure of the overall decay in crystal quality during the diffraction measurement process. Negative values are used in exceptional instances where the final intensities are greater than the initial ones. If no measurable decay has occurred, the standard uncertainty should be quoted to indicate the maximum possible value the decay might have. A range of 3 standard uncertainties is considered possible. Thus 0.0(1) would indicate a decay of less than 0.3% or an enhancement of less than 0.3%.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_standards_number term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The number of unique standard reflections used during the measurement of the diffraction intensities.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_standards_scale_sigma term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The standard uncertainty (e.s.d.) of the individual mean standard scales applied to the intensity data.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _diffrn_standards_scale_u term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The standard uncertainty of the individual mean standard scales applied to the intensity data.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _exptl_absorpt_coefficient_mu term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The absorption coefficient mu in reciprocal millimetres calculated from the atomic content of the cell, the density and the radiation wavelength.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _exptl_absorpt_correction_type term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The absorption-correction type and method. The value 'empirical' should NOT be used unless more detailed information is not available.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _exptl_absorpt_process_details term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Description of the absorption process applied to the intensities. A literature reference should be supplied for psi-scan techniques.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _exptl_crystals_number term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The total number of crystals used for the measurement of intensities.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _exptl_special_details term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Any special information about the experimental work prior to the intensity measurements. See also _exptl_crystal_preparation.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _exptl_transmission_factor_max term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The calculated maximum value of the transmission factor for the specimen. Its value does not include the effects of absorption in the specimen mount. The presence of this item does not imply that the structure factors have been corrected for absorption. The applied correction should be given by _exptl_absorpt_correction_T_max.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _exptl_transmission_factor_min term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The calculated minimum value of the transmission factor for the specimen. Its value does not include the effects of absorption in the specimen mount. The presence of this item does not imply that the structure factors have been corrected for absorption. The applied correction should be given by _exptl_absorpt_correction_T_min.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _exptl_crystal_colour term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The colour of the crystal.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _exptl_crystal_colour_lustre term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The enumeration list of standardized names developed for the International Centre for Diffraction Data. The colour of a crystal is given by the combination of _exptl_crystal_colour_modifier with _exptl_crystal_colour_primary, as in 'dark-green' or 'bluish-violet', if necessary combined with _exptl_crystal_colour_lustre, as in 'metallic-green'.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _exptl_crystal_colour_modifier term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The enumeration list of standardized names developed for the International Centre for Diffraction Data. The colour of a crystal is given by the combination of _exptl_crystal_colour_modifier with _exptl_crystal_colour_primary, as in 'dark-green' or 'bluish-violet', if necessary combined with _exptl_crystal_colour_lustre, as in 'metallic-green'.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _exptl_crystal_colour_primary term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The enumeration list of standardized names developed for the International Centre for Diffraction Data. The colour of a crystal is given by the combination of _exptl_crystal_colour_modifier with _exptl_crystal_colour_primary, as in 'dark-green' or 'bluish-violet', if necessary combined with _exptl_crystal_colour_lustre, as in 'metallic-green'.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _exptl_crystal_density_diffrn term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Density values calculated from the crystal cell and contents. The units are megagrams per cubic metre (grams per cubic centimetre).

entry.description: Corresponds to the _exptl_crystal_density_meas term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Density values measured using standard chemical and physical methods. The units are megagrams per cubic metre (grams per cubic centimetre).

entry.description: Corresponds to the _exptl_crystal_density_meas_gt term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The value above which the density measured using standard chemical and physical methods lies. The units are megagrams per cubic metre (grams per cubic centimetre). _exptl_crystal_density_meas_gt and _exptl_crystal_density_meas_lt should not be used to report new experimental work, for which _exptl_crystal_density_meas should be used. These items are intended for use in reporting information in existing databases and archives which would be misleading if reported under _exptl_crystal_density_meas.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _exptl_crystal_density_meas_lt term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The value below which the density measured using standard chemical and physical methods lies. The units are megagrams per cubic metre (grams per cubic centimetre). _exptl_crystal_density_meas_gt and _exptl_crystal_density_meas_lt should not be used to report new experimental work, for which _exptl_crystal_density_meas should be used. These items are intended for use in reporting information in existing databases and archives which would be misleading if reported under _exptl_crystal_density_meas.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _exptl_crystal_density_meas_temp term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Temperature in kelvins at which _exptl_crystal_density_meas was determined.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _exptl_crystal_density_meas_temp_gt term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Temperature in kelvins above which _exptl_crystal_density_meas was determined. _exptl_crystal_density_meas_temp_gt and _exptl_crystal_density_meas_temp_lt should not be used for reporting new work, for which the correct temperature of measurement should be given. These items are intended for use in reporting information stored in databases or archives which would be misleading if reported under _exptl_crystal_density_meas_temp.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _exptl_crystal_density_meas_temp_lt term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Temperature in kelvins below which _exptl_crystal_density_meas was determined. _exptl_crystal_density_meas_temp_gt and _exptl_crystal_density_meas_temp_lt should not be used for reporting new work, for which the correct temperature of measurement should be given. These items are intended for use in reporting information stored in databases or archives which would be misleading if reported under _exptl_crystal_density_meas_temp.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _exptl_crystal_density_method term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The method used to measure _exptl_crystal_density_meas.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _exptl_crystal_description term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: A description of the quality and habit of the crystal. The crystal dimensions should not normally be reported here; use instead _exptl_crystal_size_ for the gross dimensions of the crystal and _exptl_crystal_face_ to describe the relationship between individual faces.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _exptl_crystal_F_000 term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The effective number of electrons in the crystal unit cell contributing to F(000). This may contain dispersion contributions and is calculated as F(000) = [ (sum f~r~)^2^ + (sum f~i~)^2^ ]^1/2^ f~r~ = real part of the scattering factors at theta = 0 f~i~ = imaginary part of the scattering factors at theta = 0 the sum is taken over each atom in the unit cell

entry.description: Corresponds to the _exptl_crystal_id term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Code identifying each crystal if multiple crystals are used. It is used to link with _diffrn_refln_crystal_id in the intensity measurements and with _refln_crystal_id in the _refln_ list.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _exptl_crystal_preparation term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Details of crystal growth and preparation of the crystal (e.g. mounting) prior to the intensity measurements.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _exptl_crystal_pressure_history term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Relevant details concerning the pressure history of the sample.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _exptl_crystal_recrystallization_method term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Describes the method used to recrystallize the sample. Sufficient details should be given for the procedure to be repeated. The temperature or temperatures should be given as well as details of the solvent, flux or carrier gas with concentrations or pressures and ambient atmosphere.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _exptl_crystal_thermal_history term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Relevant details concerning the thermal history of the sample.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _exptl_crystal_face_perp_dist term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The perpendicular distance in millimetres from the face to the centre of rotation of the crystal.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _geom_special_details term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The description of geometrical information not covered by the existing data names in the geometry categories, such as least-squares planes.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _geom_angle term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Angle in degrees defined by the three sites _geom_angle_atom_site_label_1, *_2 and *_3. The site at *_2 is at the apex of the angle.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _geom_angle_publ_flag term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: This code signals whether the angle is referred to in a publication or should be placed in a table of significant angles.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _geom_bond_distance term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The intramolecular bond distance in angstroms.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _geom_bond_multiplicity term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The number of times the given bond appears in the environment of the atoms labelled _geom_bond_atom_site_label_1. In cases where the full list of bonds is given, one of the series of equivalent bonds may be assigned the appropriate multiplicity while the others are assigned a value of 0.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _geom_bond_publ_flag term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: This code signals whether the bond distance is referred to in a publication or should be placed in a list of significant bond distances.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _geom_bond_valence term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The bond valence calculated from _geom_bond_distance.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _geom_contact_distance term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The interatomic contact distance in angstroms.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _geom_contact_publ_flag term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: This code signals whether the contact distance is referred to in a publication or should be placed in a list of significant contact distances.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _geom_hbond_angle_DHA term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Angle in degrees defined by the three sites _geom_hbond_atom_site_label_D, *_H and *_A. The site at *_H (the hydrogen atom participating in the interaction) is at the apex of the angle.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _geom_hbond_publ_flag term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: This code signals whether the hydrogen-bond information is referred to in a publication or should be placed in a table of significant hydrogen-bond geometry.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _geom_torsion term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The torsion angle in degrees bounded by the four atom sites identified by the _geom_torsion_atom_site_label_ codes. These must match labels specified as _atom_site_label in the atom list. The torsion-angle definition should be that of Klyne and Prelog. Ref: Klyne, W. & Prelog, V. (1960). Experientia, 16, 521-523.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _geom_torsion_publ_flag term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: This code signals whether the torsion angle is referred to in a publication or should be placed in a table of significant torsion angles.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _publ_contact_author term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The name and address of the author submitting the manuscript and data block. This is the person contacted by the journal editorial staff. It is preferable to use the separate data items _publ_contact_author_name and _publ_contact_author_address.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _publ_contact_author_address term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The address of the author submitting the manuscript and data block. This is the person contacted by the journal editorial staff.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _publ_contact_author_email term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: E-mail address in a form recognizable to international networks. The format of e-mail addresses is given in Section 3.4, Address Specification, of Internet Message Format, RFC 2822, P. Resnick (Editor), Network Standards Group, April 2001.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _publ_contact_author_fax term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Facsimile telephone number of the author submitting the manuscript and data block. The recommended style is the international dialing prefix, followed by the area code in parentheses, followed by the local number with no spaces. The earlier convention of including the international dialing prefix in parentheses is no longer recommended.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _publ_contact_author_id_iucr term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Identifier in the IUCr contact database of the author submitting the manuscript and data block. This identifier may be available from the World Directory of Crystallographers (http://wdc.iucr.org).

entry.description: Corresponds to the _publ_contact_author_name term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The name of the author submitting the manuscript and data block. This is the person contacted by the journal editorial staff.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _publ_contact_author_phone term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: Telephone number of the author submitting the manuscript and data block. The recommended style is the international dialing prefix, followed by the area code in parentheses, followed by the local number and any extension number prefixed by 'x', with no spaces. The earlier convention of including the international dialing prefix in parentheses is no longer recommended.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _publ_contact_letter term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: A letter submitted to the journal editor by the contact author.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _publ_manuscript_creation term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: A description of the word-processor package and computer used to create the word-processed manuscript stored as _publ_manuscript_processed.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _publ_manuscript_processed term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The full manuscript of a paper (excluding possibly the figures and the tables) output in ASCII characters from a word processor. Information about the generation of this data item must be specified in the data item _publ_manuscript_creation.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _publ_manuscript_text term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The full manuscript of a paper (excluding figures and possibly the tables) output as standard ASCII text.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _publ_requested_category term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The category of paper submitted. For submission to Acta Crystallographica Section C or Acta Crystallographica Section E, ONLY those codes indicated for use with those journals should be used.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _publ_requested_coeditor_name term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The name of the co-editor whom the authors would like to handle the submitted manuscript.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _publ_requested_journal term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The name of the journal to which the manuscript is being submitted.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _publ_author_address term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The address of a publication author. If there is more than one author, this will be looped with _publ_author_name.

entry.description: Corresponds to the _publ_author_email term in the IUCr Core CIF dictionary.
entry.definition: The e-mail address of a publication author. If there is more than one author, this will be looped with _publ_author_name. The format of e-mail addresses is given in Section 3.4, Address Specification, of Internet Message Format, RFC 2822, P. Resnick (Editor), Network Standards Group, April 2001.
